title: How many calories are burnt while walking? - Quora

response.answer_text: How many calories do I lose by walking? Bianca, humans expend energy (over and above basal metabolic rate - BMR - which is there just to stay alive - even if in bed 24/7 ), on a pretty even scale when walking and this is:- between 2 and 5 calories per kilogram per HOUR. The faster you walk (say 6kph/7kph - my normal walking pace on the flat but I am tallish, with long legs), the more energy you need. For me this would put it about 3 calories/kg/hr. Walk up a steep slope - then I’d push that to 4 or even 5cal/kg/hr. Running - this would push things to say 6 calories/kg/hr - again depending on speed (i.e., effort) and terrain. There is a lot of misinformation on the internet - but this energy expenditure rate has been known and well researched for over 100 years. To illustrate what I mean I cite The British Antarctic Polar Expediton (1911 - 1912) - Falcon Scott’s journey to the South Pole, was done on 4,500 calories a day (very high in fats - for energy) - probably half or less than what was necessary, but done by careful calculations from naval and army experience in cold climates. Woefully under their neds, probably because they miscalculated a shelter component (lack of).More recently two men (one British and one American), man-pulled sledges across Antarctica (in the same manner as Scott’s), and calculated on 8,000 to 9,000 calories.In actual fact - ALL - expeditions expended something like 10,000 to 11,000 calories a day as both lost significant weight, pulling heavy sleds in extreme conditions for upward of ten hours a day. The weight of the sled is added (as would be a pack). However, if you work that out, they still only burned 9 to 10 calories an hour.Incidentally, recent research (stimulated by re-reading Scott’s diary), also reveals that Scott’s expedition was weakened by incipient - if not actual - scurvy. Of course this would have exacerbated the lack of food and extreme temperature they experienced ( minus 40), further weakening the men. Answer Follow· 1 Request
